poem:
"Beyond the Laughter's Echo"

Laugh, but in silence consider-
Thomas, breeding his jests
In the shadow lands between thought 
And breath; A court jester's echo
Bouncing off caverns vast,
Strewn with remnants of Whoopsie Daisy.
Four years erased by the winking sun,
Yet he rises, Phoenix-stirred,
From the ashes of jest, 
Birthed anew - embracing his simple complexity,
Tidying up the inner turmoil with humour and stage lights.
